resources.string: Without location permissions app won\'t be able to access Wi-Fi network names which is crucial part for automation.
Starting with Android 10, background services are restricted to start apps/activities on users screen, meaning it won\'t be able to launch Android Auto without this permission.
Starting with Android 10, location needs to be "Allowed all the time" in order to connect Android Auto Wireless
Please turn on Wi-Fi to start Android Auto Wireless
This will turn the service off that connects AA wirelessly if it loses bluetooth connection. Recommended for users that Headunit is not turning hotspot off after turning the car off.
Select on which Bluetooth devices to start this app
Bluetooth was off, re open it again
Adds a button in service notification to force connection to HUR (needs service restart)
Set connected status based on Wi-Fi connection

This will set if connection with HUR was established based on Wi-Fi connection status. Turn it on only if phone is not sending Android Auto Enter/Exit Intents and you are facing issues. Consider using it with Force Connect Button to try to make it work
Note: Consider if Headunit is rooted it can reset hotspot settings to default (HUR/AndroidAutoConnect) every time it starts
Service is running and connected to HUR
Service is running and looking for HUR
Headunit Reloaded Wi-Fi Service is running trying to connect Android Auto Wirelessly
